title: The Peddler Merlinus
opening: The dying words of Lord Helman stun Eliwood beyond belief. “Darin, the marquess of Laus, knows all…” Despite the pain it brings, Eliwood takes this newfound knowledge to heart and sets out for Laus once again. On the way to Laus, he travels through a Caelin village. Eliwood and his party decide to rest there for a night.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Bah! Dark already.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: We'll have to stop here for the night. We'll set out for Laus at the first sign of sunlight. Marcus, prepare the camp.

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: Yes, my lord.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: So this is Caelin? You think we ought to present ourselves to Lord Hausen?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: We're simply passing through, so I don't see the need. I am curious how Lyndis is getting along, though.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Lyndis?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Marquess Caelin's granddaughter.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Oh, her. The missing heir who dealt with Lundgren last year. Didn't you have something to do with that?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Mm.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: And? The granddaughter? Is she a beauty?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: A beauty? She's... I don't...she's... I think it must be her Sacae heritage. She's...striking...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Striking? Too bad, isn't it?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: That we don't have time to see her, loverboy.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: No! Lyndis and I are... We're not...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You're not? Then why are you getting so worked up?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Hector! Don't make me angry!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Ha ha ha ha! You are so much fun to tease! Huh? What was that? Did you hear something?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: It was a scream. Someone's being attacked!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Do we help?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Of course!

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Oh noooooo! Someone! Help!!!

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Grrr! Stupid old fool! He's kept us running in circles for hours!

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: My... My valuable merchandise! What are you going to do?

intro.speaker: Puzon
intro.line: Hey, look at this. The old fool's wealthy.

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Huh huh huh. Our lucky day. Eh, Puzon?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Let go! Let go!! Will you let go!!!

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: What a racket! Puzon, can we get rid of this simpleton?

intro.speaker: Puzon
intro.line: I suppose so. There's no reason to let him live.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Oh my!! Eeeyaaaaahhh!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Release him!

intro.speaker: Puzon
intro.line: Who--

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I told you to let the man go!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: If you move quickly, we'll let you live.

intro.speaker: Puzon
intro.line: Ha! A pair of dandies like you? You know what I think? Living off your parents' names, prancing about... I despise you! Come on! Don't hold back! We'll kill you all!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Hold! Release that man!

intro.speaker: Puzon
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: We're not after you, dullard. We want the old man and his goods. If you value your life, you'll leave now.

intro.speaker: Puzon
intro.line: What did you say? Who do you think you are? Do you think you can walk away with our spoils?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You half-wit! Do we look like thieves to you?

intro.speaker: Puzon
intro.line: We'll not let our profit be snatched away so easily! Come! To me now! Hold nothing back! Kill 'em all!

battle.speaker: Merlinus
battle.line: Aaaiiieeee!!! You! They call you Mark, am I right? I am Merlinus, a humble and lowly merchant. I know nothing of combat. Please! You must protect me!

end.speaker: Bandit
end.line: Oof… Blast! I won’t forget this!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Then you’re smarter than you look! Get out of here!!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Are you all right?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Hm? Oho!! I… I’ve been saved!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: We’ve driven them off. Are you injured?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: No, not at all. As you can see, I’m as fine as fine can be.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: I’m glad to see that. Good day, sir. Hector.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Wait a moment, please! A token of my thanks…

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Do not worry yourself. We did nothing to merit reward.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: That’s right. We’ve no need of a peddler’s junk.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: P-P-Peddler?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hector!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Oops!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Ahem! I am Merlinus. You’ll find no other traveling merchant whose goods compare. Don’t let your eyes fool you: I’m quite prosperous.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Huh? You’re a merchant? Books and knives and all that, eh?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hector, your manners are terrible. Merlinus, please… Pay no mind to what this oaf has to say.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: No, of course not. I wasn’t concerned at… Ahem! By the way, you two obviously come from highborn houses. Would you grant me the honor of your names?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: I am Eliwood, son of the marquess of Pherae.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I’m Hector. Marquess Ostia’s brother.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Goodness! Ostia! Pherae! The greatest houses in all of Lycia!! Ahh… To be saved by noblemen such as yourselves… It is an honor beyond words!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: It’s nice to be appreciated for a change. Lately, people just seem to want us dead. Tell me, Merlinus, what are your plans?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Pardon? My plans, my lord? I had planned to travel Lycia selling my merchandise, but… It may not be possible in such dangerous times.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: If that’s the case, why don’t you come along with us?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hector?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Our travels will not be ending anytime soon. We’ve gained more people and more items, right? It might be good to have help managing our things.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Oho! Now THAT is a splendid idea! Managing merchandise is my specialty, after all!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Are you sure?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Quite sure, my lord. To be honest, I’ve dreamt of working for a noble house. To have my fondest wish granted in such a way… I cannot stem these tears of joy! Lord Hector! Lord Eliwood!!! Take me into your bosoms and keep me safe forever!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Uh… Thank you. Well met, Merlinus.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: We’re counting on you! Now, I’ve got some things I want you to carry…

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Yes, of course. Whatever you have, Merlinus will keep!
